Walter Bircher
About Publications Projects News Links

Just for fun, industry work, and unpublished research projects

Projects

Quick Pickles
WG Bircher
Doc Wally B's Gourmet Pickles with fresh dill, coriander seeds, peppercorns, crushed garlic, & mustard seeds — made as a gift for a friend, 2022
Sample-Matic
WG Bircher, Ethan Muchnik
An automatic 25 vial liquid sample collector for Miller or FISH assays, built for a friend in the Kim Biophysics lab at the University of Illinois, 2021
La Boca Blocks
WG Bircher
Recreated game blocks for La Boca (a spatial reasoning strategy game), 3D printed with PLA and hand painted as a gift for a friend, 2021
Deadset on Malevolence Digital Art Layout
Dummy Head Torpedo, WG Bircher
CD digital art layout for the sophomore album 'Deadset on Malevolence' of Omaha punk band Dummy Head Torpedo, 2020
UV Curing Chamber
WG Bircher
A UV curing chamber for photoreactive resin-based 3D prints, featuring a rotating platform, made as a prototype for Tethon 3D, 2020
Combination Washer Dryer
Pamela Banner, Zachary Wright, Mitchell Smith, Victoria Palmer
A fast-cycle combination washer / dryer made by a team of MENG488 seniors that I mentored as part of my duties as Teaching Fellow at Yale, 2020
CNC Enclosure
WG Bircher
An enclosure for the Genmitsu-3018 CNC with a wifi camera to monitor jobs in progress, while reducing noise over 20dB and containing dust, 2020
CNC'd Wooden Keychains
WG Bircher
My first project using the Genmitsu-3018 CNC, transforming a digital photograph of a family dog into engraved & painted wooden keychains, 2019
Automatic Worm Catching Device
Saif Alnuaimi, Kevin Liang, Raymond O'Mahoney, Julia Zou
An automatic worm catching device made by a team of MENG488 seniors that I mentored as part of my duties as Teaching Fellow at Yale, 2018
OpenHand Workshop 2018
WG Bircher, supervised by Aaron Dollar
I hosted, planned, and organized the 2018 Yale OpenHand Workshop (part of NEMS), where labs from 8 regional universities built and took home their very own fully functional Model O Hands, 2018
MARS Finger
WG Bircher, taught by Aaron Dollar
A 3D printed underactuated finger modeled after Gosselin and Laliberte's MARS Hand for the course Advanced Robotic Mechanisms at Yale, 2018
Variable Stiffness Revolute Joint
WG Bircher, Ali Yawar
A hand-machined metatarsal inspired variable stiffness revolute joint, 2017
Macaque Brain Coasters
WG Bircher
From digital images to 3D printed slices of macaque brain, cast in clear urethane as coasters, 2017
Dali's Lobotomy Digital Art Layout
Dummy Head Torpedo, WG Bircher
CD digital art layout for the breakthrough album 'Dali's Lobotomy' of Omaha punk band Dummy Head Torpedo, 2017
Mallet Tester
WG Bircher, Kramer Milan
A device to measure the 'bounce' of percussion mallets, using an absolute encoder and an Arduino UNO, in collaboration with Kramer Milan, 2017
Cast Pewter Axolotl Pin
WG Bircher
A decorative pin, designed in Photoshop, modeled and 3D printed, imprinted into Delft Clay to form a mold, cast in solid pewter, and hand painted, 2017
Low Cost 3D Scanner
WG Bircher, taught by Holly Rushmeier
A low-cost Arduino controlled 3D scanner using VSFM made for the course Computational Issues in 3D Design & Fabrication at Yale, 2016
SmartGrasp Underactuated Prosthetic Hand
WG Bircher, Michael Leddy, taught by Brian Scassellati
SmartGrasp, an open source upper-limb prosthetic device based on the Model T42, built for the course Intelligent Robotics at Yale, 2016
Caulk Nozzle
WG Bircher
A 3D printed screw-on reusable tip for tubes of caulk, to keep the material within from drying out, 2015
Suction-Irrigation Gripper for Miniature Surgical Robot
WG Bircher, Mark Reichenbach, taught by Carrick Detweiler
A multifunctional gripper for a surgical robot, capable of grasping, suction, and irrigation, built for the seminar course Robotics Today at UNL, 2015
Ceramic Powder Compression Printer
WG Bircher, Greg Pugh
A hacked Z Corp powder printer with a novel compression mechanism to increase part density, resulting in Tethon 3D's US Patent 10,449,692, 2015
PotBot
WG Bircher, taught by Shane Farritor
A pot stirring robot made for the course Advanced Mechatronics at UNL featuring a custom designed printed circuit board, 2015
Multiuse Tooltip for Surgical Robot
WG Bircher
A combination cautery / grasper for miniature surgical robots, designed and assembled at the Center for Advanced Surgical Technologies at UNL, 2015
Fitting Surrogate in the Polaris at JPL
WG Bircher, supervised by Brett Kennedy
I used SolidWorks to find a configuration of JPL's 21 Degree of Freedom Surrogate robot fit for driving a Polaris Ranger, as part of the DARPA Robotics Challenge, 2014
Chassis Stiffening Upgrade for Surrogate at JPL
WG Bircher, Yong Lin, supervised by Brett Kennedy
An investigation into torso instability of JPL's 21 Degree of Freedom Surrogate robot, resulting in a chassis stiffening upgrade, 2014
Underactuated Hand
WG Bircher, Eric Gutierrez, Bryant Klotthor, advised by Carl Nelson
A 3D printed underactuated gripper to increase accessibility of out-of-reach items for wheelchair bound individuals, designed as part of Capstone Mechanical Design at UNL, 2014
Battery Pack Assembly for Surrogate at JPL
WG Bircher, Yong Lin, supervised by Brett Kennedy
A battery pack for JPL's 21 Degree of Freedom Surrogate robot, enabling untethered mobility, 2014
Miniature Surgical Robots in Microgravity
Tom Frederick, Kearney Lackas, Anton Simorov, WG Bircher
A mobile surgical suite to facilitate testing of miniature surgical robots in microgravity, aboard a ZeroG Plane, supporting research in the Center for Advanced Surgical Technologies at UNL, 2014
Track Deflection Measurement System
WG Bircher, Mark Reichenbach
A sensor suite to measure track deflection and flag weak sections for maintenance, from a moving train, supervised by Shane Farritor at UNL in collaboration with MRail, 2013
Stanford Intro to Haptics Class
Taught by Allison Okamura
I participated in the first ever session of Allison Okamura's Stanford OpenEdX Online Introduction to Haptics course, where I assembled and programmed a 1-DOF haptic controller supplied by the CHARM Lab, 2013
Powered Lower Limb Orthotic Device
WG Bircher, supervised by Jason Herman
I designed and built a first prototype of a powered lower limb orthotic device to assist in stair climbing during my summer internship at Honeybee Robotics in New York City, 2013
Wise Grip - Trombone Hand Rest
WG Bircher, Jay Wise
An ergonomic hand rest for the trombone, designed on behalf of Jay Wise, Trombone player in the Omaha Symphony. For sale at Schmitt Music, Thompson Music, Hickey's Music Center, and www.wisegrip.com, 2012
Miniature Oven for Vacuum Chamber
WG Bircher, advised by Martin Centurion
An oven designed to vaporize fragile biomolecules inside a vacuum chamber, while preserving molecular structure. Machined on lathe from aluminum stock with embedded resistive heaters for the Ultrafast Dynamics Lab at UNL, 2011
Watch Renderings
WG Bircher
Rendering O clock watches to build my SolidWorks skills, 2011
Mousetrap Car
Trevor Jaixen, WG Bircher
A two-wheeled mousetrap car with records for wheels took 1st place for longest distance traveled in a Omaha Public School District wide competition, 2010
Vex FIRST Robot
Daniel Geschwender, WG Bircher
Dan and I founded the Omana North High School FIRST Robotics Club and eventually made it to the Championship of the Americas, 2007
Gibson Les Paul Renderings
WG Bircher
Modeled and rendered a Gibson Les Paul from scratch to improve my Autodesk Inventor skills in my Project Lead the Way course at Omaha North High School, 2006
Toy Robot Renderings
WG Bircher
Modeled and rendered a toy robot from scratch to improve my Autodesk Inventor skills in my Project Lead the Way course at Omaha North High School, 2006
